page.title: 12CHANGING TIMES
page.content: In 1985 Crowan Village has very few amenities. In{1905,}however, there were three pubs and two shops that sold everything. The pubs were used by miners who worked at Wheal Grenville and Wheal Crenver. There were two schools: a boys' school which was by the bridge and the girls' school which is the Sunday School today. The ages of the children that went to school ranged from {five to fourteen years.}Water came from a spring by the bridge. There was no electricity, just lamps for light and a cornish range to cook on. Most of the people were{miners but some were{farmers.}People mainly used horse and cart. The blacksmith had a great deal of work. {The mill}was also in use.{The size} {of the village and its population was {about the same as it is today.}
